1002ID:1507805479623225346allthewildworld#ClimateAction, #FightforEarth!https://t.co/W6VK8QnZZ8Building and operating telescopes can generate a lot of greenhouse gases. In fact, it's as if each astronomer in the world was driving more than 100,000 miles per year, a new study finds."the annual carbon footprint of astronomy's research infrastructure is equivalent to about 20 million metric tons of [CO2, not including] scientists' travel to conferences, supercomputing power and office heating" Take #ClimateAction, #FightforEarth!https://twitter.com/allthewildworld/status/15078054796232253462022-03-26 19:43:34"the annual carbon footprint of astronomy's research infrastructure is equivalent to about 20 million metric tons of [CO2, not including] scientists' travel to conferences, supercomputing power and office heating" Take , !
